keyTakeAways: The San Jose Sharks displayed an offensive message on their scoreboard during a Hispanic Heritage Night event that appeared to praise Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), sparking public backlash.
The message, 'SJ SHARKS FANS LOVE ICE !! GET ‘EM BOYZ !', was posted during the first intermission and was deemed inappropriate by fans and the team.
The Sharks apologized, stating the message was 'offensively worded' and did not reflect the organization’s values, and confirmed it was not part of their standard review process.

The incident occurred during a celebration of the team’s commitment to the Bay Area’s Hispanic community, highlighting a conflict between cultural inclusivity and the use of controversial symbols or references.
The team is investigating the origin of the message, which was submitted externally and displayed without proper screening.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The San Jose Sharks apologized for displaying an offensive message on their scoreboard during a Hispanic Heritage Night game against the Pittsburgh Penguins, which read 'SJ SHARKS FANS LOVE ICE !! GET ‘EM BOYZ !'. Fans, including fan Jessica Clark, expressed outrage, and the team stated the message was externally submitted, inappropriate, and did not reflect their values. The message was displayed during a celebration of the team’s commitment to the Bay Area’s Hispanic community, raising concerns about cultural sensitivity and content moderation in sports. The Sharks have launched an investigation into the source of the message and are reviewing their content screening processes.
title: San Jose Sharks Apologize for ‘Offensively Wordered Message’ Displayed During Hispanic Heritage Night
